column2: "Are you an ARKS member? Are you willing to accept my request?"
"Thank you so much. You're really a life saver!"
"I'm a research student studying the formation of the planets. It just that I can't find much data on Naberius."
"It's the first planet ARKS go to for training, and yet there's very little information available on it."
"Sorry, I got caught up in thought. My name is Rogio."
"The content of my request is very simple: a geological survey of Naberius."
"I have a hunch that I really want to look into."
"Even when I ask other ARKS members, they don't seem to think there's anything new to be learned about Naberius."
"And then you came along, <%me>. Thank you so much!"
"Please, whenever you have the time is fine!"
"<%me>, I was just thinking about contacting you."
"About investigating Naberius... I gave it some thought, and I need more data."
"<%me>, since you know the situation, I thought it would be best to ask you."
"The forest data you gathered before was sufficient. This time I need some data from the tundra."
"There being a lush forest right next to a frozen tundra seems paradoxical to begin with."
"But it's obviously there, so there's no choice but to accept that. Still, I have an odd feeling about it."
"There's no detailed information on its formation, so it seems like the ARKS are trying to hide something."
"Ah. Sorry. As a researcher, I need facts, not opinions."
"If I have doubts, then the only way to find out what's going on is to investigate."
"Sorry to trouble you again, but I'm counting on you."
